该门课程是基于学生团队合作，完成和解决在实际生活中的工程项目问题以及进行实验设计。这门课程开发学生发现问题、解决问题，分析数据、设计实验以及文献检索、科技文档撰写等方面的能力。
该课程包括信息检索、数据分析、实验设计、报告撰写等过程，通过使用电子学、光学的基础知识，解决实际生活中的实际问题，培养学生运用所学知识解决问题的能力。\x07
Mathematical Skills Used For Guided Wave Calculation
Mathematical Skills Used For Guided Wave Calculation

A matrix form of Maxwell equation will be introduced. The use of basic matrix calculation will applied to several guided wave structure, including partially filled waveguide and anisotropic waveguide. Numerical study case will be shown by use of MATLAB (or Scilab) language on a number of classic applications. Design examples will be given for microwave phase shifters and isolators.

The course is based around the following subject areas: Constellations: Orbital Dynamics from Kepler to Newton; Satellite Orbital Design; Systems and Applications: Mobile Satellite Systems, Networks and Applications; Very Small Aperture Terminal Networks; Radio Interface: Link Budget Design from basic transmission theory to advanced link calculations; Digital Modulation Techniques including and Phase Shift Keying; Multiple Access Techniques, covering CDMA, TDMA and FDMA; Regulatory Issues; Mobile and Fixed Propagation Environment including empirical and statistical representations; Satellite Payload Design, from transparent to on-board processing architectures.

The course will be based around the following areas: Introduction to mobile and wireless systems: System aspects of current mobile and wireless Communications systems: 2G (GSM), 2.5G (GPRS), 3G (UMTS, HSDPA, HSUPA), GERAN and UTRAN, and LTE. Regulatory and standardization bodies; Mobile IP; Wireless communications; Local Area Networks; Personal Area Networks; Metropolitan Area Networks.

This course provides a guideline for students to have practical understanding of the process of academic research. The course content includes research designs, developing a quality research plan, basic research methodology: research instruments, data collection, data analysis, as well as documentation. It will particularly emphasize on preparation for a research project in language education.

This course is designed as a practical guide for the preparation of well-written academic reports. The course provides students with an opportunity to write different types of reports, including a reading report, an interview report, an annotated bibliography, and a research paper. Emphasis is on clarity of content, concise expressions, and correct format of report organization..
Integral Equation Techniques for Passives Microwaves Structures Modeling
Integral Equation Techniques for Passives Microwaves Structures Modeling

This course is an introduction of integral equation method for microwave passives structures modelling. Will be discussed: survey of integral equation techniques, GREEN's function definition, GREEN's function construction in various conventional waveguides, discontinuity analysis formulation par multimodal variational method, planar transmission line characteristics formulation by GREEN's function technique, and some interesting application in microwave engineering.

This course is prepared for the students ranging from undergraduates who understand at least the basic physics and optics to graduates in physics, material sciences, and electrical engineering, particularly, display technologies. It deals with the basic sciences and device applications of liquid crystals. Liquid crystals exhibit the material properties of solids with the flow properties of fluids and provide the foundation for a revolution in low- power, flat-panel displays.This course consists of8 classes (each 90 minutes) in series that cover four main topics of liquid crystals; the fundamental physical properties, the optical and electro-optical properties,display technologies, and optical device applications. It begins with an historical account of the discovery of liquid crystals and continues with a description of how different phases are generated and what the fundamental propertiesintrinsic to the various types of liquid crystals are. In the second part, a comprehensive description of optics and electro-optics associated with liquid crystals is given. In the third, the basic principles underlying liquid crystaldisplays, for example, the twistednematic, super-twisted nematic, vertical alignment, and in-plane switching modes, are discussed. In the last, a variety of opticaldevices made of liquid crystals including lenticular lens arrays for autostereoscopic displays are described.

本课程意在使学生对创新创业的实际场景有一定程度的深入了解和接触，加强学生在创新创业领域的思辨、团队和动手实操能力，提升学生将创造性思维和落地执行及解决问题结合起来的能力，培养学生在未来工作中的领导力，使学生能更好的将学校学到的专业知识、自己的创新创意和现实生活、行业实践更好的结合起来，并在课程实践中重树学生的创新能力和综合素质，激发学生的创新潜力，并提升其投身于TMT领域的行业竞争力。本课程是帮助有创业想法和创业潜力的学生，获得撰写BP以及路演材料的经验，完成一次正式的商业计划书宣讲和路演活动

2）路演材料准备与模拟路演

搜索引擎技术与数据挖掘
Search engine technology and data mining

1．	使同学们了解平常经常用到的搜索引擎背后的技术原理，解开搜索引擎的神秘面纱。
2．	使同学们了解数据挖掘的基本算法思想，培养同学们对当前比较热门的IT技术研究方向：大数据分析的兴趣，并了解数据挖掘技术在搜索引擎（包括智能WEB系统）中的应用。
3．	使同学们了解与数据挖掘与搜索引擎技术相关的部分其他学科知识（如：统计自然语言处理）。
4．	通过对同学们经常使用的搜索引擎技术以及经常会听到的数据挖掘技术的分析，激发同学们对IT与互联网技术的兴趣，并了解本科中学习的部分理论在实际中的应用。1．使同学们了解数据挖掘的部分基本算法思想以及在现实中的一些应用实例。
2. 使同学们了解搜索引擎技术的基本框架、技术原理以及数据挖掘思想在搜索引擎中的应用。
3.通过对搜索引擎与数据挖掘部分核心技术与算法的分析，使同学们了解本科部分专业课程内容在实际产品与技术中的应用，如：《数据结构与算法分析》（应用于爬虫技术、中文分词）、《概率论与数理统计》（应用于自动文本分类）、《高等数学》（应用于自动文本分类）等

1．第1、2课时，介绍搜索引擎技术的主体架构、基本原理以及数据挖掘技术在其中的应用。
2. 第3课时，介绍搜索引擎采集层的爬虫技术，并简单介绍图论在采集层的应用。
3. 第4、5课时，介绍搜索引擎索引层的索引技术，并简单介绍中文搜索引擎所使用的关键算法：中文分词算法。
4.第6、7、8课时，以搜索引擎推荐系统为例，介绍数据挖掘技术在搜索引擎中的应用，并通过推荐系统，向同学们介绍自动文本分类技术的原理与实现
军用软件开发项目管理
本课程意在使学生对实际软件开发过程中的项目管理有所了解和接触，加强学生在军用软件开发时的编码规范和文档编写能力，培养学生在未来工作中的团队合作精神。使学生能更好的将学校学到的专业知识和现实行业实践更好的结合起来。本课程是帮助有从事软件开发工作意向的学生，了解工程软件的开发流程，特别是军用软件开发过程中需编写的文档，使学生可以在将来的工作中快速进入角色。

本课程重点内容包括：
1）软件项目开发流程。
2）军用软件开发管理
软件无线电发展趋势与应用前景
Development Tendency & Application Prospect in SDR
